Package interactr.cs.kuleuven.be.ui

Class DiagramView

  • java.lang.Object
    • interactr.cs.kuleuven.be.ui.DiagramView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DiagramObserver, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommunicationView, SequenceView

    public class DiagramView
extends java.lang.Object
implements DiagramObserver, java.lang.Cloneable
    An abstract interface for diagram views. Diagram views can display diagrams in a coordinate system. They allow for manipulation and selection of diagram components.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected Diagram diagram
      The diagram associated with this diagram view.
      protected PMap<Party,Figure> figures
      A hashmap containing figures of all parties in this diagram view.
      protected PMap<Message,Link> links
      A hashmap containing links of all messages in this diagram view.

      Initialize this new diagram view with the given diagram.

      • addParty

        public void addParty​(int x,
                     int y)
              throws InvalidAddPartyException
        Creates a new party at the given coordinates in this view's diagram.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the new party.
        y - The y coordinate of the new party.
        Throws:
        InvalidAddPartyException - The given party cannot be added to this diagram view at the given coordinate.

        public void switchTypeOfParty​(int x,
                              int y)
        Switch the type of the party at given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the party.
        y - The y coordinate of the party.

      • getSelectableComponent

        public DiagramComponent getSelectableComponent​(int x,
                                               int y)
        Returns a selectable diagram component at given location, or null if no component is selectable at that coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to look at.
        y - The y coordinate to look at.
        Returns:
        The selectable diagram's component at given location in this view, or null if no such component is visible at the given coordinate.

      • getComponent

        public DiagramComponent getComponent​(int x,
                                     int y)
        Returns the diagram component at given location, or null if no component is present at that coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to look at.
        y - The y coordinate to look at.
        Returns:
        The diagram component at given location in this view, or null if no such component is visible at the given coordinate.

      • getComponent

        protected DiagramComponent getComponent​(int x,
                                        int y,
                                        DiagramComponent excludedComponent)
        Returns the diagram component at given location, or null if no component is present at that coordinate. The given excluded component, if not null, is ignored.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to look at.
        y - The y coordinate to look at.
        excludedComponent - The component to ignore when looking for the component at given coordinate.
        Returns:
        The diagram component at given location in this view, or null if no such component is visible at the given coordinate.

      • figureForParty

        protected Figure figureForParty​(Party party)
        Returns the figure for the given party held by this view.
        Parameters:
        party - The party whose figure is desired.
        Returns:
        The figure associated with the given party, or null if there is none.

        y - The y coordinate for the figure.

      • moveParty

        public void moveParty​(int fromX,
                      int fromY,
                      int toX,
                      int toY)
               throws NoSuchPartyException,
                      InvalidMovePartyException
        A method that moves the given party to the given coordinates
        Parameters:
        fromX - The start x coordinate for the add.
        fromY - The start y coordinate for the add.
        toX - The end x coordinate for the add.
        toY - The end y coordinate for the add.
        Throws:
        NoSuchPartyException - If there is no party at the given start coordinates.
        InvalidMovePartyException - If the party could not be moved to the given end coordinates.

        Creates a link for the given message.
        Parameters:
        message - The message for which a link is created.
        Returns:
        A link representing the given message in this view.

      • createLinkForMessage

                                    int fromX,
                                    int fromY,
                                    int toX,
                                    int toY)
        Creates a link for the given message at the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to make a link for.
        fromX - The from x coordinate for the message.
        fromY - The from y coordinate for the message.
        toX - The to x coordinate for the message.
        toY - The to y coordinate for the message.
        Returns:

      • getMessageInsertionIndex

        public int getMessageInsertionIndex​(int fromX,
                                    int fromY,
                                    int toX,
                                    int toY)
        Returns the index of the message lying right above a message, if inserted at the the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        fromX - The start x coordinate for the message to insert.
        fromY - The start x coordinate for the message to insert.
        toX - The start x coordinate for the message to insert.
        toY - The start x coordinate for the message to insert.
        Returns:
        The index at which a message should be inserted if added at the given coordinates.

      • canInsertMessageAt

        public boolean canInsertMessageAt​(int fromX,
                                  int fromY,
                                  int toX,
                                  int toY)
        Checks whether a message can be inserted at the given coordinates. This method does not check for validity of the callstack after addition of the message to the diagram itself.
        Parameters:
        fromX - The start x coordinate for the message.
        fromY - The start y coordinate for the message.
        toX - The end x coordinate for the message.
        toY - The end y coordinate for the message.
        Returns:
        True if and only if a message can be inserted at the given coordinates.

      • addMessage

        public void addMessage​(InvocationMessage message,
                       int fromX,
                       int fromY,
                       int toX,
                       int toY)
        Add the given message from the given start to the given end coordinates.
        Parameters:
        message - The message that is to be added.
        fromX - The start x coordinate for the message.
        fromY - The start y coordinate for the message.
        toX - The end x coordinate for the message.
        toY - The end y coordinate for the message.
        Throws:
        InvalidAddMessageException - If a message could not be added.

      • getInvocationMessageForCoordinates

        public InvocationMessage getInvocationMessageForCoordinates​(int fromX,
                                                            int fromY,
                                                            int toX,
                                                            int toY)
        Returns the invocation message representing the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        fromX - The start x coordinate for the message's link.
        fromY - The start y coordinate for the message's link.
        toX - The end x coordinate for the message's link.
        toY - The end y coordinate for the message's link.
        Returns:
        A message whose link coincides with the given one.

      • registerMessages

        protected void registerMessages​(InvocationMessage invocation,
                                ResultMessage resultMessage,
                                Point startCoordinates,
                                Point endCoordinates)
        Registers the given invocation message and result message in this diagram view, using the given start/end coordinates.
        Parameters:
        invocation - The invocation message that is to be registered.
        resultMessage - The result message that is to be registered.
        startCoordinates - The start coordinates for the invocation message's link.
        endCoordinates - The end coordinates for the invocation message's link.
